info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued May 27 at 3:30PM EDT until May 28 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers will be heavily swamped by waves. Northwest wind 10 to 20 mph with waves 3 to 6 feet. * WHERE...In Indiana, La Porte county. In Michigan, Berrien county. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL IMPACTS...Water temperatures in the upper 40s can cause hypothermia in as little as a hour, be very careful if you go in the water without a wet suit.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. Do not venture out on piers.
